intro: Matthiola thessala, commonly known as the Balkan stock, is a flowering plant native to the Balkan Peninsula. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes many other garden flowers and vegetables. The plant produces clusters of small, fragrant, four-petaled flowers that are typically white or pale pink. Its foliage consists of lance-shaped leaves that are hairy and aromatic. Matthiola thessala is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and for its historical use in traditional medicine.
